name: Honey-Garlic Chicken Thighs
author: Eric VanLandingham
summary: This is one of my family's favorite recipes. It's garlic-sweet and the cilantro tops it off.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed
7 cloves garlic, chopped, or to taste
1 pinch onion powder, or to taste
1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste
directions: Season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper
Cover the bottom of a cast iron skillet with olive oil and bring to medium-high heat
Add chicken and brown on one side, 3 to 5 minutes
Flip chicken, and add onion and garlic; continue to cook until chicken is mostly (but not fully) cooked and onion and garlic are soft, 5 to 7 minutes more
Add honey, soy sauce, onion powder, garlic powder, and onion powder to the skillet
Stir and scrape the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon to get the garlic and onion to mix with the liquid
Put chicken back into the pan, cover, and reduce heat to medium
Cook until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 10 more minutes, turning once halfway through
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a thigh should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Place on a serving tray and drizzle liquid from the pan on top
Sprinkle with chopped cilantro before serving
